content.description: Friction up off the ground through a steep tricky slab bulge clipping bolts. Easy friction leads to an overlap which is easily protected and overcome by utilizing a couple of cracks. More easy slab gets you to a 2 bolt anchor and a stunning view. Originally led ground up with zero bolts but that might make it feel like you are flying too close to the sun ;) Bolts were later added by the first ascensionist to make it fun!
content.protection: 5 bolts to a ring anchor. Careful pulling the rope there is a flake that wants to eat ropes.
content.location: As you walk the base of the slabs from right to left look for a nice friction groove leading up from the ground through a steep slab and leading to a right angling overlap above. That's the line.

content.description: A beautiful piece of Whitehorse transplanted to the mountainside. A good beginner slab lead in the way that Standard Route on Whitehorse is. The crux happens down low on the initial friction by a bolt. The sweeping corner is a cruise. As you get to it's top, exit up to huecos and eventually real friction. Clip a couple of bolts through here and you are on to the 2 bolt anchor.A spectacular place to be exploring easy climbing.
content.protection: A few bolts and some gear placements. Ring anchor
content.location: From the main wall as you get to the slabs this is the first route you will get to. Look for mellow slab and some obvious features such as a nice sweeping left facing corner.

content.description:
On the left end of the High Camp Area you will find a collection of cliffs offering Whitehorse-like climbing. From 5.5 friction to harder routes involving steep bulges and overlaps. Secluded doesn't quite get the point across. This is a true wilderness climbing experience. Not a hint of traffic noise or any of the other distractions you might find elsewhere. That's what makes it worth the hike.  

  Mixed protection is the standard on the slabs. Typically you will find bolts where you need them and you can place gear where you want it.
